titleStmt.title: The Muses Elizium lately discouered, by a new way ouer Parnassus. The passages therein, being the subiect of ten sundry nymphalls, leading three diuine poemes, Noahs floud. Moses, his birth and miracles. David and Golia. By Michael Drayton Esquire.
titleStmt.author: Drayton, Michael, 1563-1631.
Drayton, Michael, 1563-1631. Moyses in a map of his miracles. aut

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Thomas Harper, for Iohn Waterson, and are to be sold at the signe of the Crowne in Pauls Church-yard,

notesStmt.note: "Moses, his birth and miracles" was originally published in 1604 as: Moyses in a map of his miracles.
Reproduction of the original in Harvard University. Library.

place.placeName: the signe of the Crowne in Pauls Church-yard
